subject: Critical Thinking
title: The Misinformation Effect: Rewriting Memory
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Misinformation Effect: Rewriting Memory.

hook.text: Elizabeth Loftus showed people a car crash video & asked 'How fast were the cars when they smashed?' Speed estimates.

buildup.text: The word 'smashed' instead of 'hit' changed what people remembered seeing â€” even adding broken glass that didn't exist.

discovery.text: Memory isn't a recording. It's a reconstruction â€” rebuilt every time you recall it, and vulnerable to new information.

twist.text: Leading questions can implant entirely false memories. Some subjects remembered events that never happened.

climax.text: This is why eyewitness testimony is unreliable â€” the Innocence Project overturned 375+ convictions based on it.

punchline.text: Your memory is confident. That doesn't make it accurate.
